intro: Tribulus macropterus var. collenetteae, commonly known as the Collenette's Tribulus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spiny fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind and animals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
